raw:
Arnold: Hey, have you guys heard about the recent discovery on Mars?

Rachel: No, what is it?

Arnold: Apparently, NASA found evidence of water on Mars.

Sam: Wow, that's impressive.

Rachel: Wait, are you serious? That's not true.

Arnold: What do you mean? I read an article about it yesterday.

Rachel: I don't think that's true. There hasn't been any recent news about water on Mars.

Sam: Yeah, I haven't heard anything about that either.

Arnold: Well, I'm pretty sure it's real.

Rachel: You shouldn't believe everything you read online. Always fact-check your sources.

Sam: Yeah, it's important to make sure you're getting accurate information.

Arnold: Oh, I see what happened. I accidentally read a fake news article.

Rachel: Ah, that makes more sense.

Sam: It's always a good idea to double-check information before sharing it with others.

Arnold: Thanks for letting me know. I'll be more careful in the future. 

Rachel: No problem, it happens to all of us.

sentences.text: Hey, have you guys heard about the recent discovery on Mars?
sentences.textPhonetics: "Hey, hæv ju gaiz hɜrd əbaʊt ðə ri-sənt dɪsˈkʌvri ɒn mɑːz?"

sentences.text: Apparently, NASA found evidence of water on Mars.
sentences.textPhonetics: əˈpærəntli, ˈnæsə faʊnd ˈɛvɪdəns əv ˈwɔtər ɒn mɑːz.

sentences.text: Wait, are you serious? That's not true.
sentences.textPhonetics: /weɪt, ɑː juː ˈsɪəriəs? ðæts nɒt truː./

sentences.text: What do you mean? I read an article about it yesterday.
sentences.textPhonetics: "wɒt du ju miːn? aɪ riːd ən ɑːtɪkl əˈbaʊt ɪt ˈjɛstədeɪ."

sentences.text: I don't think that's true. There hasn't been any recent news about water on Mars.
sentences.textPhonetics: aɪ doʊnt θɪŋk ðæts truː. ðer hæzənt bɪn ɛni ɹisnt nuz əbaʊt wɔtər ɑn mɑrz.

sentences.text: Yeah, I haven't heard anything about that either.
Well, I'm pretty sure it's real.
You shouldn't believe everything you read online. Always fact-check your sources.
sentences.textPhonetics: /ju ˈʃʊdnt bɪˈliv ˈɛvriθɪŋ ju rid ˈɑnlaɪn. ˈɔlweɪz fækt-ʧɛk jɔr ˈsɔrsɪz./

sentences.text: Yeah, it's important to make sure you're getting accurate information.
sentences.textPhonetics: jə, ɪts ɪmˈpɔrtənt tu meɪk ʃʊr ˈjʊr ˈɡɛtɪŋ ˈækjərət ˌɪnfərˈmeɪʃən.

sentences.text: Oh, I see what happened. I accidentally read a fake news article.
sentences.textPhonetics: /əʊ, ˈaɪ siː wɒt ˈhæpənd. aɪ əkˈsɪdəntəlɪ rɛd ə feɪk njuz ˈɑːtɪkl/

sentences.text: It's always a good idea to double-check information before sharing it with others.
sentences.textPhonetics: ɪts ɔːlweɪz ə ɡʊd aɪˈdiːə tuː ˈdʌbəl-ʧek ˌɪnfərˈmeɪʃən bɪˈfɔː ˈʃeərɪŋ ɪt wɪð ˈʌðərz.

sentences.text: Thanks for letting me know. I'll be more careful in the future.
sentences.textPhonetics: /θæŋks fɔr ˈlɛtɪŋ mi noʊ/. /aɪl bi mɔr ˈkɛrfəl ɪn ðə ˈfjutʃɚ/.

sentences.text: No problem, it happens to all of us.
sentences.textPhonetics: nəʊ ˈprɒbləm, ɪt ˈhæpənz tu ɔːl əv ʌs.
